result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Esh Fisher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Daniel Esh Fisher is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Daniel Esh Fisher was found guilty of 2nd Degree Sexual Assault/Use of Force, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(2)(a).
  • Daniel Esh Fisher was found guilty of Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant sentenced to 5 years in the Wisconsin State Prison and 7 years Extended Supervision.

superMiscConds.notes:
Any treatment deemed necessary by the DOC.
No contact with victim K.G.S. or her family.
No contact with anyone under the age of 18 with out a pre-approved chaperone.
Submission of DNA sample, if not already attained.

supervisions.notes: Defendant sentenced to 7 years Extended Supervision

Defendant sentenced to 1 year 6 months in the Wisconsin State Prison concurrent to Count 2 and 2 years Extended Supervision concurrent to Count 2.
Concurrent with: Count 2

Defendant sentenced to 2 years Extended Supervision concurrent with Count 2.
Conditions concurrent with Count 2.
Count 4

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall pay costs in the amount of $268.00 and DNA surcharge in the amount of $250.00.

charges.descr: Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 1:45 pm.   DA Gill, Atty Bucher, and defendant appeared.  Mr.  Wilbur Martin, a treatment provider gave testimony to the Court.  He is affirmed and testified.  No questions of the witness by the parties. 
Atty Bucher tells the Court that the Elders are present that have filed letters with the Court.  DA has no questions for the Elders.  The Court has read the letters and has no questions for the Elders.  DA has not argument
as the plea agreement was handled by the previous DA.  Atty Bucher speaks for the Elders as they did not wish to speak.  DA has no additional comment.  Defendant makes statement to Court.
to Judge from Aaron King, Aaron Beiler, Elam Allgyer

Case called at 11:38 AM.  Defendant Daniel Esh Fisher in court with attorney Jane Ellen Bucher.  Jenna L Gill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Bucher informs the Court the Defendant is prepared to enter a No Contest plea to Count 2 and Count 4.  Attorney Bucher files Plea Questionnaire and Waiver or Rights form and requests that previous Cash Bond be amended to add additional residence he may reside and add names of individuals that Defendant may be supervised by.  Attorney Bucher files Plea Agreement with the Court.  Court questions Defendant regarding his plea change, the plea questionnaire and plea agreement.  Court questions Attorney Bucher regarding plea agreement, the plea questionnaire and the Defendant's plea change.  Parties stipulate to factual basis.  State waives jury trial.  Court is satisfied Defendant enters his plea of No Contest to Counts 2 and 4 knowingly, freely, intelligently, and voluntarily and will accept that plea, adjudicating him Guilty on these 2 counts.  Court orders PSI be completed within 60 days of today's date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 26, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact with the residence located at 19425 North Lake Road, Town of Fayette.
Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact with K.G.S. (DOB 09/13/1999).
Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact with any immediate family member of Amos Stoltzfus Jr.
Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact with any female under 18 years of age. 
Defendant is allowed to attend church services where females under the age of 18 are present but he must be supervised at all times by one of the persons listed below.
Defendant cannot be involved with any youth activities on weekends.
Defendant is allowed visits with males under the age of 18, these visits shall be supervised by one of the parties listed below.
Defendant shall reside at 8361 County Highway G in Argyle, WI., or at 14893 Woods Branch Road in Darlington, WI.
Defendant must be supervised any time he leaves either home located at 8361 County Highway G, or 14893 Woods Branch Road.
Defendant must be supervised at all times by one of the following persons (the accountability team).
